pageContext.claim: “[WHO] never viewed it as that serious. So, you know, it's one of those things that we're the one that is the primary funder, and so we're going to take a very strong look at that.”
pageContext.analysis: WHO debated whether or not to call covid-19 a pandemic, as far back as January, suggesting they were taking the virus seriously. U.S. funding accounts for 15 percent of the World Health Organization’s total funding, which while significant, does not mean the organization is “primarily funded” by the U.S.
